content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────
### Resource Depot & Smelting Facility at base position (x=-4.5, y=18.5)
Consists of:
• Wooden Chest at (x=-4.5, y=18.5) serving as central storage.
• Stone Furnace at (x=-3.0, y=19.0) for iron smelting.
• Stone Furnace at (x=-4.0, y=21.0) for copper plate production.
• Burner Inserter at (x=0.5, y=21.5) with drop at (x=0.5, y=20.5).

### Automation Lab & Steam Power System (Integrated System) at base configuration
Consists of:
• Lab at (x=-7.5, y=18.5) dedicated to automation research.
• Boiler at (x=-5.5, y=24.0) supplying thermal energy.
• Steam Engine at (x=6.5, y=34.5) for power output.
 – Note: Recent attempts to reposition a steam engine to (x=-3.5, y=24.5) near the boiler failed due to missing inventory and crafting sub-ingredient shortages; the unit remains unconnected.
• Offshore Pump at (x=-7.5, y=25.5) supporting fluid intake.
• Electricity Group with small electric poles at (x=-0.5, y=11.5), (x=-7.5, y=15.5), (x=-4.5, y=15.5), (x=3.5, y=19.5) and (x=1.5, y=22.5).
• Dual PipeGroups forming the fluid network at (x=-10.5, y=16.5) & (x=-12.5, y=18.5) and at (x=-8.5, y=20.5) & (x=-2.5, y=21.5).

### Copper Cable Factory at position (x=1.5, y=19.5)
Consists of:
• Assembling Machine at (x=1.5, y=19.5) – originally set to run the copper‑cable recipe but recently reconfigured for Iron Gear Wheel production; production remains stalled with repeated extraction errors.
• Burner Inserter at (x=1.5, y=17.5).
• Input Chest at (x=2.5, y=17.5) for resource input.
• Output Chest at (x=1.5, y=21.5) dispatching finished products.
• Dedicated Copper Buffer Chest at (x=-5.5, y=21.5).
• Dedicated Transport Belt Segment at (x=0.5, y=17.5) linking outputs.
• Additional Burner Inserters at (x=2.5, y=16.5) and (x=3.5, y=17.5).

### Copper Extraction System (adjacent to the copper smelting furnace)
Consists of:
• Extraction Burner Inserter at (x=-3.5, y=23.5) with pickup at (x=-3.5, y=22.5) and drop at (x=-3.5, y=24.5).
• Copper Buffer Chest at (x=-3.5, y=26.5).
• Chest Extraction Burner Inserter at (x=-3.5, y=27.5) with pickup at (x=-3.5, y=26.5) and drop at (x=-3.5, y=28.5).
• Belt Source Inserter at (x=-3.5, y=25.5).

### Extraction Belt Depot at position (x=3.5, y=15.5)
Consists of:
• Wooden Chest at (x=3.5, y=15.5) serving as the belt depot.
• Dedicated Transport Belt Segment at (x=4.5, y=15.5) for copper plate conveyance.
• Depot Burner Inserter at (x=3.5, y=14.5) with pickup at (x=3.5, y=15.5) and drop at (x=3.5, y=13.5).

### Belt Connection Target Setup for Copper Extraction
Consists of:
• Extraction Source: Wooden Chest at (x=3.5, y=15.5).
• Extraction Inserter at (x=4.5, y=15.5) with pickup at (x=3.5, y=15.5) and drop at (x=5.5, y=15.5).
• Manual Transport Belt Chain comprising:
 – Horizontal segments at (x=7.5, y=15.5) and (x=8.5, y=15.5) (note: blocked placement at (x=6.5, y=15.5)).
 – Vertical segments at (x=8.5, y=14.5), (x=8.5, y=13.5), (x=8.5, y=12.5) and (x=8.5, y=11.5) (note: occupancy error at (x=8.5, y=10.5)).
• New Target Inserter at (x=8.5, y=9.5) with pickup at (x=8.5, y=10.5) and drop at (x=8.5, y=8.5).
• Belt Chain Burner Inserter Refueling Subsystem comprising:
 – Burner Inserters at (x=6.5, y=9.5), (x=7.5, y=9.5) and (x=8.5, y=9.5) operating with reduced fuel levels.
 – Additional Burner Inserters at (x=3.5, y=14.5) and (x=5.5, y=14.5).

ERROR TIPS
────────────────────────
• RESOURCE AND POWER SUPPLY:
 – Furnaces continue to face ingredient shortages; ensure raw material feeds remain uninterrupted.
 – Core modules (assembler and lab) are experiencing power deficits. Verify both electrical connectivity and fuel levels for boilers.
 – The Boiler remains flagged NO_FUEL despite refueling; monitor fuel dispatch to maintain operations.

• STEAM ENGINE CONNECTION AND REPOSITION:
 – Reposition attempts for the steam engine near the boiler failed due to insufficient inventory and missing sub-ingredients for crafting; confirm availability of required components before repositioning.
 – Ensure fluid connection points are unobstructed and properly aligned when integrating steam engines into the power network.

• BURNER INSERTER FUEL MANAGEMENT:
 – Multiple burner inserters are issuing low fuel and “out of fuel” warnings. Review fuel distribution to guarantee timely refueling across the network.

• TILE PLACEMENT & OCCUPANCY:
 – Several electric pole placement attempts were blocked due to existing entities (e.g. a burner inserter at (x=1.5, y=17.5) and a wooden-chest at (x=1.5, y=21.5)); verify target tile availability and adjust spacing/direction accordingly.
 – Similar occupancy errors affected manual belt placements; pre-validate unoccupied positions before placement.

• ASSEMBLER POWER & EXTRACTION:
 – The assembling machine at (x=1.5, y=19.5) remains in a NO_POWER state despite multiple connection attempts (including a successful link to an existing pole at (x=3.5, y=19.5)), and subsequent extraction of iron‑gear‑wheels repeatedly fails. Confirm that power propagation is effective and production outputs are present before attempting extractions.

• RESOURCE & CRAFTING SUPPLY:
 – Crafting of the steam engine failed owing to missing sub-ingredients (iron‑gear‑wheels and their precursor iron‑plates). Maintain rigorous tracking of prerequisite components to support advanced crafting operations.

• VARIABLE DEFINITION:
 – A NameError regarding ‘repositioned_steam_engine’ indicates that variables were referenced before proper assignment. Initialize and define all variables prior to use.

• GLOBAL SYSTEM CONFIGURATION:
 – Persistent challenges in power distribution and resource delivery suggest a need for further alignment and integration of core system configurations to stabilize overall operations.
